Lumpy skin disease: Farmers demand vaccines and reject culling
subhead: After vaccination zones and a protection zone were implemented in the Occitanie region of southern France, concern is now growing in the Aveyron. The department, home to 500,000 cattle, has the largest herd in the region, with half of them being the Aubrac breed.

title: Bangladesh: Assassination of student protest leader sparks violence and heightens tensions with India
subhead: The assailants who killed the young man reportedly fled to India, where former prime minister Sheikh Hasina has also taken refuge after being forced to resign following the protests of August 2024.

title: Da Vinci's secret tunnels at Milan's Sforza Castle appear to be nothing more than sewers
subhead: Researchers from the Politecnico di Milano claim to have discovered mysterious underground passages beneath the medieval fortress that match sketches by the Italian master. But historians specializing in the period sharply dispute this theory.

title: Santa Claus in France is a temp worker: 'It helps make ends meet'
subhead: Retirees, actors, entrepreneurs: They don the role of Santa Claus in shopping malls, at Christmas markets or via video calls for private customers. Few people rush to apply for this job, which sometimes involves difficult working conditions, although the most experienced among them still appreciate it.

title: Perrier: Nestlé allowed to continue natural mineral water production despite recent contamination incidents

title: Trump dogged by cost of living crisis and Republican revolt
subhead: The US president tried to defuse Americans' dissatisfaction with the economy in a televised address on Wednesday. He continued to blame Joe Biden, but struggled to grasp the extent of the issue – provoking tensions within his own party.
